Pre-Game Insights: The Philadelphia Phillies are 85-57 on the year and play the Rays and Mets next.
The Philadelphia Phillies have scored 26 runs in their last 3 games and 4 or more runs in 5 straight games.
The Philadelphia Phillies have won 8 of their last 9 games when scoring 4 or more runs.
Alec Bohm leads the Philadelphia Phillies with 147 hits and 89 RBI, while Bryce Harper and Nick Castellanos have combined for 270 hits and 156 RBI.
The Miami Marlins are 53-89 on the year and play the Pirates and Nationals next.
The Miami Marlins have scored 13 runs in their last 3 games and 4 or more runs in 5 of their last 10 games.
The Miami Marlins have won 7 straight games when scoring 4 or more runs.
Jake Burger leads the Miami Marlins with 111 hits and 60 RBI, while Jesus Sanchez and Otto Lopez have combined for 188 hits and 88 RBI.

Seth Johnson will make his major league debut when he gets the ball today. Johnson was 9-16 with a 2.70 ERA and 269 strikeouts in his minor league career. Johnson is considered the 15th best prospect in the Phillies farm system by MLB.com.

Edward Cabrera gets the ball for the Miami Marlins, and he is 3-6 with a 5.33 ERA and 84 strikeouts this season. Cabrera has allowed 29 hits and 13 earned runs in his last 32.2 innings. Cabrera has a 4.17 ERA and .215 allowed batting average in 41 home innings. Cabrera is 1-2 with a 4.70 ERA and 19 strikeouts in his career against the Philadelphia Phillies.
